intro: Westia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled westia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Westia paniculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
